GIT

Creating A Repo

Step 1: Create the README file
  1. mkdir ~/Hello-World # Creates a directory for your project called «Hello-World» in your user directory
  2. cd ~/Hello-World # Changes the current working directory to your newly created directory
  3. git init # Sets up the necessary Git files
  4. touch README # Creates a file called «README» in your Hello-World directory
Step 2: Commit your README
  1. git add README # Stages your README file, adding it to the list of files to be committed
  2. git commit -m 'first commit' # Commits your files, adding the message «first commit»
Step 3: Push your commit
  1. git remote add origin https://github.com/username/Hello-World.git # Creates a remote named «origin» pointing at your GitHub repository
  2. git push origin master # Sends your commits in the «master» branch to GitHub

Clone A Repo

  1. Open github project: https://github.com/aw3s0me/Site
  2. Push Fork button
  3. git clone https://github.com/aw3s0me/Site.git

Copy To Bash Window
